page.title: 11LIFE IN ASHWELL
page.content: Ashwell is a place of commuters and farmers.Some villagers,like Howard Day the Baker took great pride in it: he thought it was the "best place in the world".The annual summer open day,"Ashwell At Home",also shows a lot of local pride.People like the village because it is pretty,they like the idea of living in the country,or because they've always lived there. On the other hand some Ashwell residents feel cut off from the outside world.Some newcomers would like more facilities in the village.One new arrival felt seperated from the older villagers and the newer,wealthier commuters.With high house prices it is hard for young people to come into the village. Many older villagers still think of Ashwell as a small farming village but it is no longer just that.
